entries.meaning: (chiefly historical) A murder by drowning, especially one of those carried out during the French Reign of Terror.
examples: Alongside this, there were the infamous noyades: perhaps 2,000 alleged counter-revolutionaries strapped in to barges were towed into the river Loire where the barges were scuppered, leaving the victims to drown.

verbs.description: noyade (third-person singular simple present noyades, present participle noyading, simple past and past participle noyaded)

entries.meaning: (historical, obsolete, nonce word) To murder by drowning, especially during the French Reign of Terror.
